references.paper_title: Improved automated detection of diabetic retinopathy on a publicly available dataset through integration of deep learning
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of automated diabetic retinopathy detection, providing a benchmark dataset and demonstrating the effectiveness of deep learning.

references.paper_title: A theory of learning from different domains
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for domain adaptation, which is crucial for the cross-domain disease grading problem addressed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Maximum likelihood from incomplete data via the EM algorithm
references.reason: This paper introduces the Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm, a key component of the Samba method for recalibrating state distributions.

references.paper_title: Mamba: Linear-time sequence modeling with selective state spaces
references.reason: The Mamba model, a crucial component of Samba, is introduced in this paper, providing a highly efficient and effective approach to sequence modeling.
The Mixup method, used in this paper, is a data augmentation technique to improve model generalization and is particularly relevant to the cross-domain disease grading context.
